newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat bounces higher after touching lows.
newsitem.headline: Fiat bounces higher after touching lows.

text.p: Shares in Italian industrial group Fiat pushed higher on Wednesday in moderate trading helped by news of the flotation of a stake in New Holland and as the shares bounced after hitting a year low on Tuesday.

Dealers said overnight news Fiat was to float at least 31 percent of its tractor and farm machinery division New Holland on the New York market for $1.23 billion helped the shares. Fiat said in June it wanted to float 30-40 percent of New Holland.
Other dealers said Fiat shares had hit a fresh year low on Tuesday, which at 4,085 lire was the lowest level since January 1994, and there was now some technical support at 4,100 lire.
Fiat shares gained 2.7 percent to 4,220 lire by 1215 GMT.

The shares have been under pressure recently from the poor performance of the Italian car market and the high value of the lira. On Thursday, the Italian Ministry of Transport will issue new car registration figures for September.
